description: From Middle English abrod, equivalent to a- +â€Ž brood.

adjectives.description: abrood (comparative more abrood, superlative most abrood)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Upon a brood; hatching eggs. [Attested from around (1150 to 1350) until the late 19th century.]
(figurative) Mischief. [Attested from around (1150 to 1350) until the late 19th century.]

adverbs.description: abrood (comparative more abrood, superlative most abrood)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Upon a brood; on a hatch. [Attested from around (1150 to 1350) until the late 19th century.]
(figurative) Mischief. [Attested from around (1150 to 1350) until the late 19th century.]
